articles.description: Manchester City midfielder Kevin de Bruyne scored the winner against Wolves and is bidding an emotional farewell after 11 trophy-laden years at the club - but is he leaving to soon?
articles.title: Man City 1-0 Wolves: Is Kevin de Bruyne leaving too soon?

articles.description: Andrea Kimi Antonelli takes his first Formula 1 pole position for the sprint race at the Miami Grand Prix.
articles.title: Miami Grand Prix: Andrea Kimi Antonelli becames youngest driver to take F1 pole in sprint race

articles.description: Gregg Popovich steps down from his position as head coach of the San Antonio Spurs after 29 seasons with the team.
articles.title: Popovich steps down as Spurs coach after 29 years

articles.description: Britain's Jack Draper books his spot in the Madrid Open final with a hard-fought 6-3 7-6 (7-4)  victory against Lorenzo Musetti.
articles.title: Madrid Open: Jack Draper beats Lorenzo Musetti to reach final

articles.description: Pep Guardiola says he will take a break from management after he leaves Manchester City, though he does not know when he will retire.
articles.title: Pep Guardiola to take coaching break when time at Manchester City ends

articles.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou bemoans the "negative narrative" around the club despite their success in the Europa League.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou bemoans 'negative narrative' around Spurs

articles.description: England selector Luke Wright says "runs are the currency" as a decision looms over the batting line-up for marquee series against India and Australia later this year.
articles.title: England team selection: 'Runs the currency' for Zak Crawley and Ollie Pope as Jacob Bethell decision looms

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says midfielder Jorginho is "recovering well" from a lung injury and might play again this season.
articles.title: Jorginho: Arsenal midfielder likely to feature this season after lung injury

articles.description: Dissecting Rory McIlroy's performance on the  'Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon' - including a chipping contest and his Masters doubts.
articles.title: Rory McIlroy: Masters champion's appearance on Jimmy Fallon Show

articles.description: London Marathon organisers say more than 1.1 million applications have been received for 2026, smashing the record of 840,318 set by last year's ballot.
articles.title: London Marathon 2026 ballot: Has the UK become a nation of runners?
